10 out of 10 no questions asked just absolutely love this game had fun every minute first time played it after release and even with my second walkthrough its same great fun

finally playing jagged alliance 3 and 20 hours in i know it is gonna be one of my alltime favorites  such a great game and a worthy successor to ja2 from 1999 it successfully expands on everything that made this classic amazing super fun gameplay paired with tons of engaging sidequests and quality comedy i can already see myself replaying this game many times in the future  i am playing with a controller and i was surprised how well it works after initial period of getting used to it
a very very solid strategy game with unique ui and designs you can easily sink in a lot of hours without knowing xcom with more micromanaging and personalities
some questionable development choices aside its a pretty rad game
pretty good take off ja2 i hope for expansions updates and look forward to community efforts
definitely recommend it for those who like turn based combat squad games and anyone who enjoyed jagged alliance 2
gg
finally a true and worthy successor to the classic ja games from the 90s
finally a ja that does the originals justice

enjoyed gameplay a lot

take your time to explore all management stuff make a plan and youll be alright just dont jump in and start fighting this game looks simple on the surface but goes very deep and doesnt explain much after 44 hours i have to start again because my objectives are all over the map and the enemy is taking over my territory at great speed i also missed a lot of the stories and thats a shame because there worth doing   very recommended
really fun would recommend for all strategy crpg fans

steep learning curve but totally worth the investment  looking up guides is mandatory if you do not want to learn certain things the hard way    there is a difficulty spike as many people may mention but it is easy to not progress to that point and beef up your mercs  i am addicted

this is the type of game that gets better the longer you play the early game can be tough watching your lowbudget mercenaries get bullied by small groups of frenchspeaking pirates but if you power through until you can properly equip your soldiers the game becomes a blast in every sense rpgstrategy players dont sleep on this one

i like tactical games in general and wanted to like this one but ultimately got left disappointed and dropped it as i was not enjoying and feeling im wasting time after every session  pros  nice looking graphics  cons  plot is rudimentary  combat is extremely repetitive  world map is getting constantly spammed with same enemy groups  no merc customisation   for me the gameplay turned fast into a constant slog and time drain with no feeling of completion
need to fix a few bugs but a good game  the camera control for high level bulding to to be much better than now

its jagged alliance baby while there were some previous attempts to resurrect the franchise that missed the mark this is the real deal as someone who poured many hours into the first two games this is an honest to goodness sequel that allows you to live your dream of managing a mercenary squad and it all comes with the same goofy tone of the originals come for the strategic action stay for the hr logistics and payroll management
missions are diverse and interesting

jagged alliance 3 successfully captures the essence of what made ja2 great updating it for a modern audience without sacrificing its core identity its a challenging rewarding and often hilarious tactical rpg that respects its lineage if you appreciated ja2 for its gameplay merits rather than just nostalgia youll find a lot to love here its not perfect but its easily the best jagged alliance game in a long time
a very nice mature game turnbased especially if you played all of jagged alliance 2 versions its a must buy
im a long time jagged alliance player all the way back to ja1 and im currently on my 7th playthrough of ja3  needless to say i highly recommend it

a good tactical game i have some complaints about the clarity of information and some oddities of ui some of this is obviously intended game design while some it is just strangeness however the game shines in the humor the character and the idiosyncrasies of the mercenaries just as advertised

this is a whole lot of rts fun with some good progression elements and tongueincheek humor throughout the systems and inventory can be a little tricky to figure out but its worth putting the time in to learn how this game is tactically unique and rewarding a fan of the original series and now getting to play this one as well i would highly recommend giving this game a whirl and just have a blast with it

kind of similar to wasteland 3 although a bit more polished in my opinion and i hope they make a sequel my main complaint is i feel there should be a larger pool of mercenaries to choose from just like maybe 5 more minimum you can hire from aim also the stealth can feel a little janky but if youve played a lot of xcom 2 it should come natural

i enjoy lots of turn based tactical combat games but most of them tend to be scifi or fantasy based so this one scratches an itch for players who want things a little bit more realistic  that said this isnt a sim by any means but its fun in the same way watching an 80s action movie can be which im pretty sure is what the devs were going for so good job
